metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6443 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in developer tools in Google Chrome prior to81.0.4044.92 allowed a remote attacker who had convinced the user to usedevtools to execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6443` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '81.0.4044.122-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
